skill.name: jira-workflow
skill.description: Orchestrate Jira workflows end-to-end. Use when building stories with approvals, transitioning items through lifecycle states, or syncing task completion with Jira.
skill.summary: Orchestrate Jira workflows end-to-end. Use when building stories with approvals, transitioning items...

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown guidance and code examples for Jira API integration. No executable scripts present. Network calls are to user-configured Jira instance via standard REST API. Environment variables are clearly named for Jira authentication.

content.value_statement: Managing Jira issues manually wastes time and creates tracking gaps. This skill automates story creation, workflow transitions, and approval cycles. Use it to sync Claude Code tasks with Jira status automatically.
actual_capabilities: Build SAFe-compliant user stories with acceptance criteria
Present story proposals and get user approval before creating issues
Create Jira stories, epics, and subtasks via REST API
Transition issues through workflow states (To Do, Progressing, Done)
Add implementation details and comments to Jira issues
Sync task completion with TodoWrite for automated tracking
limitations: Requires valid Jira API credentials and project configuration
Only supports Next-Gen (Team-managed) Jira projects with custom workflow states
Does not create or modify Jira boards, sprints, or project settings
Rate limited to 10 requests per second to prevent API throttling

use_cases.title: Track development progress
use_cases.description: Automatically update Jira when starting and completing coding tasks. Keep stakeholders informed in real-time.

use_cases.title: Streamline story approval
use_cases.description: Review and approve user stories before they enter the sprint. Ensure clear requirements and acceptance criteria.

use_cases.title: Sync CI/CD with Jira
use_cases.description: Automatically transition issues when deployments complete. Maintain accurate status across all environments.

prompt_templates.title: Create a new story
prompt_templates.scenario: Build and propose a new user story
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a SAFe-compliant user story proposal for: [describe the feature]. Include persona, goal, benefit, acceptance criteria scenarios, and definition of done. Present it for approval before creating in Jira.

prompt_templates.title: Start work on issue
prompt_templates.scenario: Begin working on a Jira issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Transition Jira issue [ISSUE-KEY] from To Do to Progressing. Add a comment that work has started and link to any relevant planning documents.

prompt_templates.title: Complete and sync
prompt_templates.prompt: Complete the current task and sync with Jira: transition [ISSUE-KEY] to Done, add implementation details including files modified and commits made, and update TodoWrite status.

prompt_templates.title: Bulk create from commits
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze recent git commits and create Jira stories for any work that needs tracking. Use the commit messages to build story summaries and descriptions.

output_examples.input: Create a Jira story for adding user authentication to our application
output: Story Summary: As a registered user, I want to log in with email and password, so that I can access my secure account
Acceptance Criteria: User can register with valid email, User can login with correct credentials, User sees error for invalid login, Session persists across browser refresh
Definition of Done: Code reviewed, Unit tests passing, Integration tests passing, Documentation updated, Deployed to staging
Do you want me to create this in Jira?

best_practices: Always query available transitions first using GET /rest/api/3/issue/{key}/transitions before attempting state changes
Get explicit user approval before creating Jira issues to ensure requirements are clear
Add implementation comments with file changes and commits when completing work for traceability
anti_patterns: Creating issues without user review or approval
Hardcoding Jira credentials instead of using environment variables
Skipping transition queries and assuming workflow state names are consistent

faq.question: What Jira project types are supported?
faq.answer: This skill supports Next-Gen (Team-managed) Jira projects with custom workflow states. Classic projects may require different field names for epic links.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for Jira API calls?
faq.answer: Jira allows approximately 10 requests per second. Add 100ms delays between bulk operations to avoid throttling errors.

faq.question: How do I integrate with Claude Code TodoWrite?
faq.answer: Use TodoWrite to track tasks, then call transitionTo() and addComment() when marking items complete to sync status bidirectionally.

faq.question: Is my Jira data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only accesses your configured Jira instance via your credentials. No data is sent to external services. Credentials are read from environment variables only.

faq.question: Why am I getting 404 errors when creating issues?
faq.answer: 404 errors typically mean the issue was not found or deleted. Verify your JIRA_PROJECT_KEY is correct and the issue still exists in Jira.

faq.question: How is this different from other Jira skills?
faq.answer: This skill provides end-to-end workflow orchestration including approval loops, state transitions, and implementation tracking. Many skills only handle issue creation.
